TITLE: Aging and Elderly Care in Catalonia
INTRO_TEXT: The perception that there are many elderly people in Catalonia sparked my curiosity to verify it with data. I wanted to know if this impression was a coincidence or a demographic reality. Moreover, when talking to nursing home professionals, they often mention waiting lists for admission. These observations motivated the analysis to better understand the distribution of the elderly population and the availability of residential places in the territory.
WHERE_ELDERLY_LIVE: Where do elderly people live in Catalonia?
WHERE_ELDERLY_LIVE_DESC: To understand the territorial distribution of elderly people in Catalonia, two indicators are used to identify where the population aged 65 and over is concentrated and how it has evolved over time:
POPULATION_65_PLUS_PERCENTAGE: Percentage of population aged 65 and over
RESIDENTIAL_PLACES_SUFFICIENCY: Sufficiency of residential places for the elderly population
RESIDENTIAL_PLACES_DESC: To evaluate the adequacy of residential places for elderly people in Catalonia, the coverage ratio of beds or places for the population aged 65 and over is analyzed.
REFERENCE_RATIO_DESC: According to the Socioeconomic Study of Care for Dependent People in Spain, the reference ratio is 4.11 to 5 places per 100 people over 65 years old, a value that guides future planning of residential care services.
TERRITORY_ANALYSIS_DESC: This analysis identifies territories with insufficient coverage and those with a more balanced offer relative to their elderly population.
RESIDENCE_COVERAGE_PERCENTAGE: Percentage of elderly residence coverage rate
COVERAGE_RATE_CALCULATION: The coverage rate is obtained from the quotient between the total population aged 65 and over and the total supply of places. It is expressed as a percentage
EVOLUTION_POPULATION_SERVICES: Evolution of elderly population and care services over time
EVOLUTION_DESC: The indicators show how the availability of residential places, the distribution of different types of services and their ownership (public, private or social) have varied.
TEMPORAL_ANALYSIS_DESC: This temporal analysis facilitates the identification of trends and territorial imbalances in the provision of services for the elderly population.
TREND_POPULATION_SERVICES_COMARCA: Population and services trend by comarca
TREND_POPULATION_65_PLUS: Trend of population aged 65 and over
TREND_INDICATOR_POPULATION_65_PLUS: Trend of population indicator aged 65 and over
TERRITORIAL_DETAIL_DESC: This section allows exploring each comarca and analyzing, at municipal scale, the elderly population ratio and residential places coverage.
NO_DATA_MUNICIPALITIES: Some municipalities lack data on residential places for elderly people, which may indicate a lack of supply or absence of records in available sources.
GREY_AREAS_NOTE: Grey areas indicate no data available.
POPULATION_65_PLUS_VARIATION: Percentage variation of population aged 65 and over between years {referenceYear} and {latestYear}
POPULATION_INDICATOR_DESC: Number of people aged 65 and over divided by the total population.
VARIATION_INDICATOR_DESC: Difference between the percentage of population aged 65 and over in {latestYear} and that of {referenceYear}.
COVERAGE_RATE_DESC: The coverage rate is obtained from the quotient between the total population aged 65 and over and the total supply of places. It is expressed as a percentage.
